intro: Stephanomeria blairii, commonly known as Blair's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Stephanomeria blairii is also known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
